document: {"blocks":[{"key":"67bbi","text":"1. To assess the territory volume of individual astrocytes in the mouse cortex, 100 μm-thick floating sections containing anterior cingulate cortex (ACC) and primary motor cortex (MOp) astrocytes labeled sparsely via PALE with mCherry-CAAX were collected. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33oj3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qrue","text":"2. High-magnification images containing an entire astrocyte (50-60 μm z-stack) were acquired with an Olympus FV 3000 microscope with the 60× objective. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"croho","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdlhe","text":"3. Criteria for data inclusion required that the entirety of the astrocyte could be captured within a single brain section and that the astrocyte was in layer 2/3 of the ACC or MOp. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6urbg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ktkd","text":"4. Astrocytes in which the entire astrocyte could not be captured within the section or was in other layers or outside of the ACC or MOp were not imaged. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fnhf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4iqmc","text":"5. Imaged astrocytes were analyzed using Imaris Bitplane software. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1sits","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57nvq","text":"6. Surface reconstructions were generated, and the Imaris Xtensions “Visualize Surface Spots” and “Convex Hull” were used to create an additional surface render representing the territory of the astrocyte. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erq1l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9qsm","text":"7. The volume of each territory was recorded, and astrocyte territory sizes from biological replicates were analyzed across experimental conditions using a nested two-way ANOVA followed by Bonferroni posthoc test. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1v13q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ene1","text":"8. For 3D Sholl analysis of individual PALE astrocytes, we first loaded images onto Imaris and then created a surface. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cegvo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qnt4","text":"9. After generating the surface of astrocytes, we created filaments using ‘Add new filament (leaf icon)’. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c18uv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dl4p","text":"10. For the quantification of complexity, we clicked on the gear tool on Imaris to display Sholl intersections. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tnpf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h4eb","text":"11. The number of animals and cells/animals analyzed are specified in the figure legend for each experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Mouse astrocyte territory volume analysis
